author: Staff Reporter
text:
Hundreds of devotees of Ayya Vaikundar from Tirunelveli, Thoothukudi and Kanyakumari districts gathered at Nagaraja Thidal here on Thursday to participate in a procession to Swamithoppu for celebrating Ayya’s 184th birth anniversary.

The procession, which started at Nagaraja Thidal, passed through Meenakshipuram, Kottar, Edalakudy, Kariyamanikkapuram, Suchindrum, Vazhukkamparai, Ethancadu and Swamithoppu.

Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (Tirunelveli division) operated special buses from various destinations to Swamithoppu for the benefit of the devotees of Ayya Vaikundar.

Women participated in the procession with sandal pots and devotees sang spiritual songs on Ayya Vaikundar.

The district administration had already announced a local holiday. District police had made elaborate security arrangements.

The head priest from Swamithoppu presided over the procession. Gurukkal Thanga Pandian, Payan Raja, Paiyan Kamaraj, Ananth and others participated.
title: Ayya Vaikundar’s birth anniversary: hundreds take out procession
